templates.name: Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent
templates.description: Template containing items for collecting data from LibreHardwareMonitor which needs to be installed and running on the windows machine with an active zabbix agent2.

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Memory Power
items.key: wmi.get[/Root/LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' AND name='CPU Memory'"]
items.description: CPU Memory: Power used by the memory controller within the CPU.

items.name: WMI Data Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 Data D3D Shared Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='D3D Shared Memory Used' and Index='0'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Shared Memory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GPU D3D Dedicated Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='D3D Dedicated Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU D3D Dedicated Memory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GPU D3D Shared Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='D3D Shared Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU D3D Shared Memory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GPU Memory Free
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU Memory Free'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU Memmory Free in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GPU Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU Memmory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Clock Bus Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='Bus Speed'"]
items.description: Bus Speed: The speed of the front-side bus, which connects the CPU to the main memory.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #1 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #1'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #2 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #2'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #3 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #3'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #4'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #5'"]

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #6'"]

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #7'"]

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #8 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #8'"]

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #1 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='CPU Core #1'"]
items.description: CPU Core #X: Clock speed of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #2 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='CPU Core #2'"]

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #3 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='CPU Core #3'"]

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #4 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='CPU Core #4'"]

items.name: WMI  Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #5 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='CPU Core #5'"]

items.name: WMI Clocks NVIDIA GPU Core
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='GPU Core'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Clock speed of GPU Core in MHz.

items.name: WMI Clocks NVIDIA GPU Memory
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='GPU Memory'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Clock speed of GPU Memory in MHz.

items.name: WMI Data Memory Available
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Memory Available'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Memory Available in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Memory Used in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Virtual Memory Available
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Virtual Memory Available'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Virtual Memory Available in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Virtual Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Virtual Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Virtual Memory Used in GB.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Factors Core #1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value From Sensor Where SensorType='Factor' and name='Core #1'"]
items.description:
The "Factors" section in your hardware monitoring data likely refers to a multiplier used to determine the actual operating frequency of each CPU core. The figures given (e.g., 21.167, 45.750, 47.500) are typically multipliers that, when applied to the base clock speed (bus speed), give the effective frequency of each core.

Example:

    Base Clock Speed: Let’s say it's 100 MHz (common base for simplification).
    Multiplier (Factor): For Core #1, if it's 47.500,
    Effective Frequency: 100 MHz × 47.500 = 4750 MHz or 4.75 GHz

This multiplier changes dynamically based on workload demands to adjust the processor's speed within its power, thermal, and performance limits. It's part of what's known as "dynamic frequency scaling" or "CPU throttling," where the processor adjusts its speed to optimize performance and energy usage.

The data you provided for each core likely shows a range of multipliers that the processor has applied over a given period or under specific conditions:

    The first value (e.g., 21.167) might be the minimum multiplier used when the demand is low.
    The middle value (e.g., 45.750 or 46.000) might be a typical operational multiplier under normal to high load.
    The last value (47.500) could be the maximum multiplier, possibly under conditions of maximum performance demand or turbo boost.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D 3D
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D 3D' and Index='0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D 3D in %.

D3D 3D: This measures the percentage of GPU resources being used for rendering 3D graphics. A low or zero value indicates minimal or no 3D processing activity

items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU D3D 3D in %.

This measures the percentage of GPU resources being used for rendering 3D graphics. A low or zero value indicates minimal or no 3D processing activity.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Copy
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Copy' and Index='1'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D 3D in %.

D3D Copy: These entries likely represent different contexts in which the GPU is used for copying operations—transferring data between different parts of memory. It's possible to have multiple copy engines on modern GPUs, which can handle tasks simultaneously without impacting 3D rendering performance.low or zero value indicates minimal or no 3D processing activity.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D COPY Engine #1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Copy' and Index='5'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Copy #1 in %.

These entries represent different contexts in which the GPU is used for copying operations—transferring data between different parts of memory. It's possible to have multiple copy engines on modern GPUs, which can handle tasks simultaneously without impacting 3D rendering performance.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D COPY Engine #2
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Copy' and Index='6'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Copy #2 in %.

These entries represent different contexts in which the GPU is used for copying operations—transferring data between different parts of memory. It's possible to have multiple copy engines on modern GPUs, which can handle tasks simultaneously without impacting 3D rendering performance.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D COPY Engine #3
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Copy' and Index='7'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Copy #3 in %.

These entries represent different contexts in which the GPU is used for copying operations—transferring data between different parts of memory. It's possible to have multiple copy engines on modern GPUs, which can handle tasks simultaneously without impacting 3D rendering performance.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Render
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D GDI Render'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D 3D in %.

D3D GDI Render: Refers to the use of the GPU for Graphics Device Interface (GDI) rendering tasks. GDI is an old graphics interface used by Windows for representing graphical objects and transmitting them to output devices like monitors. GDI rendering on the GPU might be utilized for older applications or specific graphical tasks that rely on GDI instead of more modern APIs like DirectX or Vulkan.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D Overlay
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Overlay' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Overlay in %.

D3D Overlay: This involves the usage of GPU resources for overlay processing, such as rendering graphical user interfaces or video overlays on top of other content.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D Security
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Security' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Security in %.

D3D Security: This metric might be related to operations that secure the content being processed or transmitted by the GPU, such as DRM-related activities to protect video content.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Decode #1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Decode' and Index='9'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Decode in %.

D3D Video Decode: Indicates how much of the GPU is being used to decode video streams. Zero percent suggests that no video decoding is happening on the GPU at that moment.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Decode #2
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Decode' and Index='10'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Decode #2 in %.

D3D Video Decode: Indicates how much of the GPU is being used to decode video streams. Zero percent suggests that no video decoding is happening on the GPU at that moment.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D Video Decode
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Decode' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Video Decode in %.

D3D Video Decode: Indicates how much of the GPU is being used to decode video streams. Zero percent suggests that no video decoding is happening on the GPU at that moment.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D Video Encode
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Encode' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Video Encode in %.

D3D Video Encode: Similar to video decode but for encoding video. This would be active when the GPU is used to encode video streams into a particular format.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Processing #1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Processing' and Index='11'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Processing #1 in %.

D3D Video Processing: This load indicates the utilization of the GPU for video processing tasks other than decode and encode. This could include color conversion, scaling, or other post-processing effects applied to video before it is displayed or further processed.

items.name: WMI Load Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Processing #2
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Processing' and Index='12'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of Intel(R) UHD Graphics 630 D3D Video Processing #2 in %.

D3D Video Processing: This load indicates the utilization of the GPU for video processing tasks other than decode and encode. This could include color conversion, scaling, or other post-processing effects applied to video before it is displayed or further processed.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GPU D3D VR
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D VR' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Video Decode in %.

D3D VR: Stands for the load related to Virtual Reality (VR) applications. If VR content is being rendered, this would show how much of the GPU's resources are dedicated to that task.

items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on Core Max Temp in °F.

items.name: WMI Intel Core i7-9750H CPU Core #1 Distance to TjMax Temp
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' AND name='CPU Core #1 Distance to TjMax'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on CPU Core #1 Distance to TjMax Temp in °F. 

TjMax: This is the maximum safe thermal junction temperature specified by the manufacturer. If the CPU's temperature reaches this value, the CPU will typically begin thermal throttling to prevent damage, by reducing power consumption and therefore its heat output. This may involve lowering the CPU frequency, reducing voltage, or even shutting down the system in extreme cases to prevent overheating.

Distance to TjMax: This value indicates how close the CPU core is to reaching its TjMax. It's essentially a buffer or headroom until the CPU reaches its thermal limit. For example, if the TjMax for the CPU is 100°C and the current temperature of the core is 85°C, the "Distance to TjMax" would be 15°C. This is a crucial parameter for understanding thermal performance and ensuring that the CPU operates within safe thermal limits.

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' AND name='CPU Core'"]
items.description: Core #X VID: Voltage identification digital for each core, showing the voltage level that the CPU requests for stable operation under different loads.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H SoC (SVI2 TFN) Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' and Name='SoC (SVI2 TFN)'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on the AMD Ryzen CPU Core Voltage.

Core (SVI2 TFN) & SoC (SVI2 TFN): Voltage supplied to the CPU cores and System on Chip (SoC), respectively. This can indicate power delivery stability.
